[LEXICON]: Repeated use of "the thing/a thing" as placeholder/incorrect word
[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures with multiple clauses
Awkward phrasing in "wriggled southwards through the provinces on but sluggish feet"
[GRAMMAR]: Missing articles/prepositions in phrases like "the stuff had small genius"

[LOGIC]: Inconsistent use of "the thing" throughout text
Confusing cause-effect relationships in political timeline
[CLARITY]: Unclear references to historical figures/events without proper antecedents
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt shifts between personal narrative and historical context
[TRANSITION]: Sudden jump from Grasse to Parisian court politics without smooth connection

[SPELLING]: "a stuff in that year of the Treaty of Aix-la-the thing"
[LEXICON]: Repeated use of "a stuff" and "the thing" instead of proper nouns (e.g., "a stuff's Boucher")
[PUNCTUATION]: Misplaced parenthesis in "the king's acknowledged mistress)--the youth's mother..."
[GRAMMAR]: Awkward phrasing in "the thing looms" and "the stuff was to be beholden to him"
[SYNTAX]: Disjointed sentence structure in "he was also required to paint an 'enlargement'... the head of the factory keeping custody..."

[LOGIC]: Sudden shift from Fragonard’s training to political quarrels between priests and parliaments
Confusing use of "the thing" and "a stuff" where specific historical terms/names should be
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt transition from Fragonard’s career to the Damiens assassination without contextual link
[CLARITY]: Unclear reference to "the Treaty of Aix-la-the thing" and its relevance to the narrative
[STRUCTURE]: Disconnected segments between Fragonard’s mother’s actions and Boucher’s studio
